data.title: Movie character study: What is PA's favorite horror villain?
data.meta_description: With Halloween now less than two weeks away, a communications company known as Frontierrecently completed a study to find out which horror movie villain is most popular in each state. "We selected 12 popular villains from classic, pre-2000 horror movies and used Google Trends to analyze their search volume in the last 12 months," according to company officials.
data.text:
With Halloween now less than two weeks away, a communications company known as recently completed a study to find out which horror movie villain is most popular in each state.

"We selected 12 popular villains from classic, pre-2000 horror movies and used Google Trends to analyze their search volume in the last 12 months," according to company officials.

, the primary antagonist in the film adaptation of Stephen King'stakes the victory as the most popular villain among all U.S. states, and was revealed as Pennsylvania's most popular horror villain.

For anyone who may have never seen "The Shining", Jack Torrance provided the infamous line:

The full link to the study is posted below along with a chart showing the distribution of popularity of all the villains throughout the country.
